gw.api.validation

Class ValidationResult

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.validation.ValidationResultBase
      • gw.api.validation.ValidationResult

  • public class ValidationResult
extends ValidationResultBase
    ValidationResult is used to read and write results of an object's validation (e.g. validation via rules, or field level validation).

    ValidationResult stores both entity level errors (general errors not associated with a particular field) and field level errors (errors associated with a particular field on an entity).

    A FieldValidation object can store the bad value which triggered the error (e.g. a mangled loss date that was imported with the claim) and may also suggests possible correct values, either as a list of objects or foreign keys (if the field is a foreign key, e.g. picking from a set of users with the last name "Shaw" if the imported ClaimDef only identifies "Shaw" as the owner). See FieldValidation to learn what information may be captured with an invalid field.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static ValidationResult Current
      Gets the current thread-local validation result, if one has been set. If no thread-local validation result has been set, this method will return null.
      EntityValidation[] EntityValidations
      Returns the full list of entity validations. Validations will only exist for those entities that had at least one ValidationIssue attached to them.

      • Fields inherited from class gw.api.validation.ValidationResultBase

        Empty, ErrorMessages, Errors, ValidationLevelPassed, Warnings

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(ValidationResult vrSource)
      Adds all the validations from another validation result. Note this method assumes no field validation conflicts or general validation conflicts exist between the source validation result and this one.
      void addError(KeyableBean bean, ValidationLevel errorLevel, String errorReason)
      Adds an error to this result for the specified bean. This is a convenience method that ultimately chains to the {@link #reject} method.
      void addWarning(KeyableBean bean, ValidationLevel warningLevel, String warningReason)
      Adds a warning to this result for the specified bean. This is a convenience method that ultimately chains to the {@link #reject} method.
      static void clearThreadLocalValidationResult()
      Clears out the thread-local validation result. This method should only be used in a pair with {@link #setThreadLocalValidationResult(ValidationResult)} as described on that method.
      static ValidationResult getCurrent()
      Gets the current thread-local validation result, if one has been set. If no thread-local validation result has been set, this method will return null.
      EntityValidation getEntityValidation(Key id)
      Returns the EntityValidation for a given entity, if one exists.
      void reject(Key id, KeyableBean relatedBean, String strRelativeFieldPath, ValidationLevel errorLevel, String strErrorReason, ValidationLevel warningLevel, String strWarningReason, String flowStepId)
      Reject a particular field of field path on a bean related to the root bean, e.g. an array element of the bean such as an Exposure of a Claim.

      Note you can indicate failure as both an error and a warning simultaneously. However, if the failure is both an error and a warning, the failure should have different error and warning levels.
      static void setThreadLocalValidationResult(ValidationResult result)
      Sets the thread-local validation result, which will be seen in subsequent calls to {@link #getCurrent}. It shouldn't be necessary to call this method directly, as the validation result should be set appropriately for the beforeCommit and beforeSave expressions. Any calls to the various "reject" methods on validatable beans will also be added to the thread-local result. This method should always be paired with a call to {@link #clearThreadLocalValidationResult} in a try/finally block, as in: ValidationResult.setThreadLocalValidationResult(result); try { . . . } finally { ValidationResult.clearThreadLocalValidationResult(); }

      • Methods inherited from class gw.api.validation.ValidationResultBase

        Adds all the validations from another validation result. Note this method assumes no field validation conflicts or general validation conflicts exist between the source validation result and this one.
        Parameters:

      • addError

        void addError(KeyableBean bean,
            ValidationLevel errorLevel,
            String errorReason)
        Adds an error to this result for the specified bean. This is a convenience method that ultimately chains to the {@link #reject} method.
        Parameters:
        bean - the entity to add the error to
        errorLevel - the ValidationLevel of the error
        errorReason - the error message

              ValidationLevel warningLevel,
              String warningReason)

        Parameters:
        bean - the entity to add the warning to
        warningLevel - the ValidationLevel of the warning
        warningReason - the warning message

      • clearThreadLocalValidationResult

        Clears out the thread-local validation result. This method should only be used in a pair with {@link #setThreadLocalValidationResult(ValidationResult)} as described on that method.

      • getCurrent

        ValidationResult getCurrent()
        Gets the current thread-local validation result, if one has been set. If no thread-local validation result has been set, this method will return null.
        Returns:
        the thread-local validation result, if one has been set

      • getEntityValidation

        EntityValidation getEntityValidation(Key id)
        Returns the EntityValidation for a given entity, if one exists.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the entity to get an EntityValidation for
        Returns:
        the EntityValidation for that entity, or null if no issues exist for that entity

      • reject

        void reject(Key id,
          KeyableBean relatedBean,
          String strRelativeFieldPath,
          ValidationLevel errorLevel,
          String strErrorReason,
          ValidationLevel warningLevel,
          String strWarningReason,
          String flowStepId)
        Reject a particular field of field path on a bean related to the root bean, e.g. an array element of the bean such as an Exposure of a Claim.

        Note you can indicate failure as both an error and a warning simultaneously. However, if the failure is both an error and a warning, the failure should have different error and warning levels.

        Parameters:
        id - The id of the entity having the validation error/warning.
        relatedBean - Bean related to the root bean
        strRelativeFieldPath - The relative path from the root bean to the field that failed validation.
        errorLevel - The corresponding level effected by the validation error.
        strErrorReason - The message that should be displayed to the user, to indicate the reason for the error.
        warningLevel - The corresponding level effected by the validation warning.
        strWarningReason - The message that should be displayed to the user, to indicate the reason for the warning.
        flowStepId - The process FlowStep that this error applies to, if any

      • setThreadLocalValidationResult

        void setThreadLocalValidationResult(ValidationResult result)
        Sets the thread-local validation result, which will be seen in subsequent calls to {@link #getCurrent}. It shouldn't be necessary to call this method directly, as the validation result should be set appropriately for the beforeCommit and beforeSave expressions. Any calls to the various "reject" methods on validatable beans will also be added to the thread-local result. This method should always be paired with a call to {@link #clearThreadLocalValidationResult} in a try/finally block, as in: 
        ValidationResult.setThreadLocalValidationResult(result);
try {
  . . .
} finally {
  ValidationResult.clearThreadLocalValidationResult();
}
        Parameters:
        result - the ValidationResult to set as the thread-local result
